claims.text: In ancient Athens, only men who were citizens could vote, while women and slaves were excluded.
claims.context: Historical voting rights in ancient Athens.

claims.text: In ancient Athens, only men who were citizens could vote, while women and slaves were excluded.
claims.context: Historical voting rights in ancient Athens.

claim_reports.claim_text: In ancient Athens, only men who were citizens could vote, while women and slaves were excluded.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The evidence consistently confirms that in ancient Athens, only free men were considered citizens with the right to vote, while women, children, and slaves were excluded from citizenship and voting rights, as supported by multiple reliable sources.

supports.title: Ancient Greeks Voted to Kick Politicians Out of Athens if Enough ...
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence confirms that in ancient Athens, only free men were considered citizens and thus had the right to vote, while women, children, and slaves were excluded from citizenship and voting rights.
supports.snippet: ... women, enslaved workers and foreign-born residents. Though the ... Athens to vote a particular citizen to be ostracised from the polis.

supports.title: Democracy (Ancient Greece) - National Geographic Education
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence confirms that in ancient Athens, only free men were considered citizens and had the right to vote, while women, children, and slaves were excluded from citizenship and voting rights.
supports.snippet: ... slaves were not considered citizens and therefore could not vote. Each year 500 names were chosen from all the citizens of ancient Athens.

supports.title: How People Voted in Ancient Elections - History.com
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence confirms that women and enslaved people were excluded from voting in ancient Athens, supporting the claim that only male citizens could vote.
supports.snippet: Women and enslaved people did not have a vote. Advertisement ... Ostraka were shards of pottery used as voting ballots in Athens. Vita ...

supports.evidence_summary: The evidence confirms that in ancient Athens, only free men were considered citizens and had the right to vote, while women, children, and slaves were excluded from citizenship and voting rights.

transcript_data.text: what is democracy have you ever wondered how the people in a country get to decide who their leaders are and what rules they should follow this is all about democracy democracy is a system where the citizens of a country have the power to choose their leaders and influence the decisions made by the government the word democracy comes from ancient Greek meaning citizens power let's go back in time to see where this idea started in ient Athens citizens would Gather in an assembly to discuss and decide on laws and other important matters however it wasn't perfect only men who were citizens could vote while women and slaves were excluded fast forward to the 18th century the French Revolution marked a significant Turning Point French citizens overthrew the absolute monarchy and for the first time the idea of universal suffrage emerged this meant that any citizen regardless of wealth could vote however women still couldn't vote at this time over time Democratic ideas spread to many other countries today democracy is based on the principle that everyone has equal rights and duties it's about respecting each other and ensuring that everyone has a say in how the country is run in a democratic system citizens vote to elect their leaders and participate in the decision- making process this is done through elections where people choose their representatives the government is accountable to the people and the rule of law ensures that everyone is treated fairly civic education plays a crucial role in sustaining democracy it teaches citizens about their rights responsibilities and how to participate in the Democratic process this education helps people understand the complexities of political life and how to make informed decisions in summary democracy is about giving power to the people ensuring everyone's voice is heard and maintaining a fair and just Society it's a system that has evolved over centuries and continues to be refined to ensure equality and justice for all

segments.text: what is
democracy have you ever wondered how the
people in a country get to decide who
their leaders are and what rules they
should follow this is all about
democracy democracy is a system where
the citizens of a country have the power
to choose their leaders and influence
the decisions made by the government the
word democracy comes from ancient Greek
meaning citizens power let's go back in
time to see where this idea started in
ient Athens citizens would Gather in an
assembly to discuss and decide on laws
and other important matters however it
wasn't perfect only men who were
citizens could vote while women and
slaves were excluded fast forward to the
18th century the French Revolution
marked a significant Turning Point
French citizens overthrew the absolute
monarchy and for the first time the idea
of universal suffrage emerged this meant
that any citizen regardless of wealth
could vote however women still couldn't
vote at this time over time Democratic
ideas spread to many other
countries today democracy is based on
the principle that everyone has equal
rights and duties it's about respecting
each other and ensuring that everyone
has a say in how the country is run in a
democratic system citizens vote to elect
their leaders and participate in the
decision- making process this is done
through elections where people choose
their representatives the government is
accountable to the people and the rule
of law ensures that everyone is treated
fairly civic education plays a crucial
role in sustaining democracy it teaches
citizens about their rights
responsibilities and how to participate
in the Democratic process this education
helps people understand the complexities
of political life and how to make
informed decisions in
summary democracy is about giving power
to the people ensuring everyone's voice
is heard and maintaining a fair and just
Society it's a system that has evolved
over centuries and continues to be
refined to ensure equality and justice
for all
